title: Super Easy Cream Cheese Flan Recipe
description: A creamy custard is poured over caramelized sugar in this super easy cream cheese flan recipe that makes a great make-ahead dessert.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Custards and Puddings Flan Recipes Super Easy Cream Cheese Flan 4.8 (5) 4 Reviews 2 Photos This super easy cream cheese flan is a delicious, creamy dessert. Submitted by kimmy73 Updated on January 27, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 1 hr 10 mins Additional Time: 3 hrs Total Time: 4 hrs 20 mins Servings: 10 Yield: 1 round baking dish Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 10 servings 1 ½ cups white sugar ¼ cup water 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk 1 (12 ounce) can evaporated milk 5 large eggs 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese 1 teaspoon vanilla extract Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Heat together sugar and water in a small saucepan over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until sugar dissolves into a light brown caramel, 8 to 10 minutes. Pour into a round glass baking dish. Place condensed milk, evaporated milk, eggs, cream cheese, and vanilla in a blender; blend into a smooth custard. Pour over caramelized sugar in the baking dish. Place the baking dish in a deep baking pan. Pour in enough water to reach halfway up the sides of the baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven until custard is set and top is light brown, about 1 hour. Carefully transfer the baking dish to a wire rack to cool to room temperature. Cover the dish with plastic wrap and refrigerate until cold, 3 to 4 hours. name: kimmy73
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).;Heat together sugar and water in a small saucepan over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until sugar dissolves into a light brown caramel, 8 to 10 minutes. Pour into a round glass baking dish.;Place condensed milk, evaporated milk, eggs, cream cheese, and vanilla in a blender; blend into a smooth custard. Pour over caramelized sugar in the baking dish.;Place the baking dish in a deep baking pan. Pour in enough water to reach halfway up the sides of the baking dish.;Bake in the preheated oven until custard is set and top is light brown, about 1 hour.;Carefully transfer the baking dish to a wire rack to cool to room temperature. Cover the dish with plastic wrap and refrigerate until cold, 3 to 4 hours.
